Home Hymns License

Sing to the Lord a New Song!

This is the online home of new hymn tunes written by Dave Marney and friends. We hope you find these hymns honoring to God and a joy to sing!
Featured:
  • As Pants the Hart
  • Bread of the World
  • Lord, Thy Word Abideth
  • View All ...
Most of the hymn texts here are from older collections of religious poetry and hymns that are no longer sung. We wanted to revive these wonderful texts and give them a new musical setting, because they are full of so many helpful and encouraging truths.
The hymns are completely free to use. Please make as many copies as you'd like! They are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution license, a very open license which encourages you to share your own arrangements and adaptations. Read more…

The Contributors

Dave Marney is the primary composer. Dave is a member of Capital Presbyterian Fairfax Church in Fairfax, Virginia. Most of the hymns were written for New Hope Presbyterian Church in Fairfax, Virginia, which Dave attended for many years. Read Dave's Christian Testimony here.
John Bennetch has written a Responsive Reading to accompany Cast Thy Burden, and a flute arrangement for Fill Thou My Life. He is a worship, liturgy, and church leadership consultant, now retired.
David Coffin, Jr. made improvements to the lyrics of Break Thou the Bread of Life and Lord, In Humility I Stand, and provided help on theological points. Dave is the Assistant Pastor of New Hope Presbyterian Church in Fairfax, VA.
Kathy Kuhl is a poet and author, and wrote three new verses for As Pants the Hart. She is a member of New Hope Presbyterian Church in Fairfax, VA.
Janet Marney wrote the lyrics to Mercy, and provided invaluable proofreading and editing help. Janet is a blogger, musician, and quilt artist.
Larry Yeager helped with altering the words of Lord, Thy Word Abideth to make them fit the tune. Larry was the pastor of Heritage Presbyterian Church in Warrenton, VA, now retired.
Christine Wolfe wrote the violin arrangement to Teach Me, O Lord. She is the violinist for New Hope Presbyterian Church in Fairfax, VA.
Paul Wolfe made improvements to the lyrics of many of the hymns, and provided help on theological points. He worked with David Coffin on Lord, in Humility I Stand. Paul is the Senior Pastor of New Hope Presbyterian Church in Fairfax, VA.
